content.description: Start on a big undercling/block and climb up using the left side of the offwidth crack, with a fragile looking crimp and a solid sidepull for the left hand in the middle of the crunchy limestone face. Top out with a good ledge and huge jugs. Maybe kinda reachy but in my opinion the most fun boulder problem here, less contrived than this description makes it seem, I swear
content.protection: one pad is plenty
content.location: Far right side of the climbable part of the lime kiln boulder, just to the left of "Right Krackend" V0 offwidth.

content.description: The right arÃªte on Lime Kiln boulder.
content.protection: High ball boulder problem or top rope from two bolts with a redirect to protect a potential swing into the face. Need 20 ft of webbing for the redirect.

content.description: A pumpy little problem in the shallow corner crack on the right side of Lime Kiln boulder. Starts in the dihedral and finishes pulling over the overhanging block.
content.protection: High ball boulder problem or set a top rope from the bolts with a redirect  to the top. Needs 20 ft of webbing for the redirect.

content.description: This is easily recognized as a series of bulges heading up to the chain anchors.
content.protection: 2 Bolts to a two bolt anchor with chains and quick link for lowering.

content.description: The right facing dihedral in the middle of Lime Kiln boulder. Starts with an easy step up and then?
content.protection: Boulder or top rope. Two bolt anchor.

content.description: On the left side of Lime Kiln Boulder. Start right of the hand crack and at the left side of the small sloping ledge. You will see the undercling hold. Start working to it and head up and left finishing where the crack meets the top out.
content.protection: Boulder or top rope. Can run long webbing to the bolts or build an anchor with some large cams. Two twenty foot webbings will get to the bolts.

content.description: Climb the face just left of the dihedral. Avoid the big foot holds to the left.
content.protection: Boulder problem or top rope. Can flip the rope into the deepest runnel to prevent a swing in case of falls.

content.description: This is the furthest route back on the right side of Lime Kiln boulder. This less than vertical off width crack needs a little cleaning.
content.protection: It can be climbed as a high ball or a top rope can be built by slinging the top with a long piece of webbing.

content.description: This climb can have a crux at the beginning  and end but both can be avoided if you choose. To use the hard start begin just right of the overhanging block and climb over to the ramp. To avoid just climb the ramp. At the top you can go hard by continuing straight up to the anchors or go left for an easier time. There is still some cleaning up to do so bring a brush.
content.protection: Five bolts lead to hanging chains and a rap ring at the top anchors.
content.location: This route is on the eastern most bluff on the cliff band. Walk East along the road from the parking and look up at the bluffs. When they seem to end head straight up. The start is just right of the small cove.

content.description: This climb was named after a hook popped while putting in a bolt on the traverse along the bottom of it and I pendulumed into a bush of poison oak. The oak is gone but the potential to pendulum remains. The holds disappear just when you think it should get easy.
content.protection: Six bolts lead to hanging chains for a rap or you can walk off.
content.location: Eastern most climb in the area. Follow directions for getting to Punji Pit.

content.description: This climb starts in the cove left of Punji Pit and finishes at the anchors for Poisonous Pendulum. To be honest I am guessing at the rating as I have only made it to the shelf and then had to aid the next two bolts before finishing the climb. Please climb it and tell me what it rates. You will not hurt my feelings or ego.
content.protection: Six draws and rap off. Can be top roped if you hike up the left side of the cliff but you should rap and clip the rope in to keep you in to the rock during your efforts.
content.location: The left most cliff a Cortizone Corner. Middle bolt line.

content.description: Takes a line up incut jugs to the top right of near-horizontal formation. Bouldery moves down low and up high separate a crux in the middle. Needs a little brushing but fun pumpy climbing.
content.protection: 9 or 10 bolts and 2 bolt anchor. May want to use longer draw on the first bolt and inset bolt on the slab to prevent rope drag. Stick clip recommended, helmet recommended.
content.location: right side of the prow. To left of the obvious squeeze chimney that is labor pains.

content.description: The crack on the right side of the front of Lime Kiln boulder.
content.protection: Boulder or top rope. Two bolts

content.description: Climb the right slanting crack on the left side of Lime Kiln boulder.
content.protection: Boulder or top rope. Can run long webbing to the bolts or build an anchor with some large cams. Two twenty foot webbings will get to the bolts. Can also be lead on trad gear. Hands and larger. .

content.description: Labor pains is a mixed route. Starts with an overhang and moves onto face climbing and finishes with an off width chimney.
content.protection: The bottom face is protected with bolts but the top section requires some large gear.
content.location: route is located on the cliff to the right of Punji Pit. Hike uphill to punji pit and then follow the cliff right to the far right side of the cliff with the beak overhang. There is a rap chain at the top.

content.description: Start on the fun overhang of incut jugs(crux) then traverse right at the 3rd bolt and head up the squeeze chimney. Belayer may want a helmet as there is some choss on the traverse. Be careful for the pendulum on the traverse.
content.protection: 7-8bolts
content.location: This route starts on the incut jugs of No glove No love for 3 bolts then traverses right to finish on Labor Pains.

content.description: A bouldery start with a crux reaching a big detached block leads to the overhanging finish on Fetal Absorption.
content.protection: 8-9 bolts
content.location: On left side of the big overhanging prow under the pine tree.

content.description: The easiest way up, following a weakness on the furthest left side of the prominent overhanging headwall. Start directly under the first bolt then trends left past 2 more bolts, then traverses right to the obvious overhang. The route is new, but most of the holds are cemented pretty well.
content.protection: 7 bolts. Recommend stick-clipping the first bolt for the V0 boulder move. You may also want to use a longer draw on the 3rd bolt because the biner can hang on the rock, then don't deck going for the 4th bolt.
content.location: Park at the base the of large overhanging wall. about 40' left of labor pains under an obvious tree growing off the top of the route.

content.description: Climb the face just left of unhinged. Try not to use the right arÃªte or the left crack.
content.protection: Boulder problem or two bolt top rope.

content.description: On the left side of Lime Kiln boulder closest to the front corner there is a small sloping ledge about chest high. Start there and go straight up.
content.protection: Boulder or top rope. Can run long webbing to the bolts or build an anchor with some large cams. Two twenty foot webbings will get to the bolts.

content.description: The obvious easiest and least vertical face as you approach Lime Kiln boulder. Lots of possible variations.
content.protection: Boulder or top rope. Two bolt anchor

content.description: This route starts on the far right side of lime kiln boulder and makes a traverse all the way around to the left and finishes with a step of to the log.
content.protection: Safe boulder problem
content.location: Obvious 20 ft tall boulder in front of Cortizone wall

content.description: The crux of this climb is in the opening moves. It starts slightly overhanging and involves some flagging and side pulls to make it to the second bolt. After that there are plenty of rests. The rock is pretty sharp so be prepared.
content.protection: 8 bolts and hangers at the top.
content.location: The route is found on the easter most end of the bluffs. It is easily seen on the face of the arete. A small trail leads directly to the climb.

content.description: The crux is getting off the ground. After that climb any of the variations using the corner, great holds and the upper crack. This is the left side corner on the front of Lime Kiln boulder
content.protection: Boulder or top rope. Two bolt anchor. Whip the rope into the deepest runnel to prevent a big swing if falling.
